Remove all files associated with the site

Source: R/reset_site.R
reset_site.Rd

Use this if you want to rebuild your site from scratch.

Usage

reset_site(path = ".")

Arguments

path

the path to the site

Examples

tmp <- tempfile()
create_lesson(tmp)
#> → Creating Lesson in /tmp/RtmpnmPsem/file35f144ba4a84...
#> ✔ First episode created in /tmp/RtmpnmPsem/file35f144ba4a84/episodes/01-introduction.Rmd
#> → Creating Lesson in /tmp/RtmpnmPsem/file35f144ba4a84...

#> ℹ Workflows up-to-date!
#> → Creating Lesson in /tmp/RtmpnmPsem/file35f144ba4a84...

#> ✔ Lesson successfully created in /tmp/RtmpnmPsem/file35f144ba4a84
#> → Creating Lesson in /tmp/RtmpnmPsem/file35f144ba4a84...

#> /tmp/RtmpnmPsem/file35f144ba4a84
if (rmarkdown::pandoc_available("2.11"))
  build_lesson(tmp, preview = FALSE)
dir(file.path(tmp, "site"))
#> [1] "DESCRIPTION"   "README.md"     "_pkgdown.yaml" "built"        
reset_site(tmp)
dir(file.path(tmp, "site"))
#> [1] "DESCRIPTION"   "README.md"     "_pkgdown.yaml" "built"

Site built with pkgdown 2.0.2.
